definition: to sweep the streets/to canvas (for votes, sales etc)

sentences.english: She's a bank manager and I'm just a road-sweeper.
sentences.chinese: 她是銀行經理，而我不過是個掃街的。

sentences.english: However, the colonial British government channelled them into the trade of sweepers.
sentences.chinese: 但是，英國殖民政府給他們安排了掃街的工作。

sentences.english: We are not respected by anyone because we are sweepers.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人尊重我們，因爲，我們是掃街的。

sentences.english: We are street cleaners, so we wear orange clothes.
sentences.chinese: 我們是掃街的人，所以我們穿橘色的衣服。

sentences.english: An army of salespeople canvassed the country to promote the new product.
sentences.chinese: 一大羣推銷員在全國掃街以推廣新產品。

definition: easily/without trouble/while one is at it/in passing/handy
to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
to depart as quick as a flash/flash mob
to celebrate a festival/after the celebrations (i.e. once the festival is over)
to reserve all the seats (or a large block of seats) at a theater, restaurant etc
to be on one's own/to be left alone/to be left out
